metadata.subject: Alan Dershowitz: 'I never had sex with Virginia Roberts'

relationships.description: Dershowitz denies Roberts' allegations and accuses her of fabricating claims
Roberts made allegations involving Epstein's properties
Dershowitz mentioned in context of Epstein case

analysis.purpose: To publicly refute sexual assault allegations and challenge accuser to repeat claims outside of court
analysis.significance: Legal defense statement from prominent attorney addressing serious allegations in high-profile Epstein case

notable_quotes: I produced my travel, phone, credit card and TV appearance records, conclusively proving that I could not have been and was not in any of these places during the time Roberts knew Epstein.
The totality of the evidence found during the investigation refutes the allegations.
I challenge her to repeat her false accusations out of court, so that I can sue her for defamation and let a jury decide.
red_flags: Allegations of financial motivation for false accusations

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this document

illegal_activity.description: This is a published opinion piece/letter to the editor discussing allegations and legal defense, not first-hand illegal activity

details: Reference to Miami Herald series 'Perversion of Justice'
Mention of emails between Roberts and a journalist

public_knowledge.context: This document is itself a published letter to the editor in the Miami Herald, indicating the allegations and defense were already public knowledge through media coverage of the Epstein case

analysis.summary: Alan Dershowitz publishes a defense letter refuting Virginia Roberts' sexual assault allegations, claiming he has conclusive evidence proving he couldn't have been at the locations mentioned and accusing Roberts of fabricating claims for financial reasons.
